009package imagingbook.common.geometry.fitting.circle.algebraic;
010
011import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
012
013import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.MatrixUtils;
014import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealMatrix;
015import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealVector;
016import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.SingularValueDecomposition;
017
018import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
019import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.PntUtils;
020import imagingbook.common.math.EigenvalueDecomposition;
021import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
022import imagingbook.common.util.SortMap;
023
024
025/**
026 * This is an implementation of the algebraic circle fitting algorithm by Pratt [1],
027 * as described in [2] (Sec. 5.5-5.6). The algorithm uses singular-value decomposition
028 * (SVD) and eigen-decomposition. See [3, Alg. 11.2] for additional details.
029 * <p>
030 * Fits to exactly 3 (non-collinear) points are handled properly.
031 * Data centering is used to improve numerical stability (alternatively, a reference
032 * point can be specified).
033 * </p>
034 * <p>
035 * [1] V. Pratt. "Direct least-squares fitting of algebraic surfaces". <em>ACM
036 * SIGGRAPH Computer Graphics</em> <strong>21</strong>(4), 145â€“152 (July 1987).
037 * <br>
038 * [2] N. Chernov. "Circular and Linear Regression: Fitting Circles and
039 * Lines by Least Squares". Monographs on Statistics and Applied Probability.
040 * Taylor &amp; Francis (2011).
041 * <br>
042 * [3] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing - An Algorithmic Approach</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
043 * </p>
044 * 
045 * @author WB
046 *
047 */
048public class CircleFitPratt implements CircleFitAlgebraic {
049        
050        private static final RealMatrix Ci =    // inverse of constraint matrix C
051                        MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(new double[][] { 
052                                {  0,   0, 0, -0.5 },
053                                {  0,   1, 0,  0 },
054                                {  0,   0, 1,  0 },
055                                { -0.5, 0, 0,  0 }});
056        
057        private final double[] q;       // q = (A,B,C,D) circle parameters
058        
059        @Override
060        public double[] getParameters() {
061                return this.q;
062        }
063        
064        /**
065         * Constructor.
066         * The centroid of the sample points is used as the reference point.
067         * 
068         * @param points sample points
069         */
070        public CircleFitPratt(Pnt2d[] points) {
071                this(points, null);
072        }
073        
074        /**
075         * Constructor.
076         * The centroid of the sample points is used as the reference point for data
077         * centering if {@code null} is passed for {@code xref}.
078         * 
079         * @param points sample points
080         * @param xref reference point or {@code null}
081         */
082        public CircleFitPratt(Pnt2d[] points, Pnt2d xref) {
083                this.q = fit(points, xref);
084        }
085
086        private double[] fit(Pnt2d[] pts, Pnt2d xref) {
087                final int n = pts.length;
088                if (n < 3) {
089                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("at least 3 points are required");
090                }
091                
092                if (xref == null) {
093                        xref = PntUtils.centroid(pts);
094                }
095                final double xr = xref.getX();
096                final double yr = xref.getY();
097
098                double[][] Xa = new double[Math.max(n, 4)][4];  // Xa must have at least 4 rows!
099                for (int i = 0; i < pts.length; i++) {
100                        double x = pts[i].getX() - xr;          // = x_i
101                        double y = pts[i].getY() - yr;          // = y_i
102                        Xa[i][0] = sqr(x) + sqr(y);                     // = z_i
103                        Xa[i][1] = x;
104                        Xa[i][2] = y;
105                        Xa[i][3] = 1;
106                }
107                // if nPoints = 3 (special case) the last row of the
108                // 4x4 matrix contains all zeros (make X singular)!
109
110                RealMatrix X = MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(Xa);
111
112                SingularValueDecomposition svd = new SingularValueDecomposition(X);
113                RealMatrix S = svd.getS();      
114                RealMatrix V = svd.getV();
115                double[] svals = svd.getSingularValues();       // note: singular values are all positive (>= 0)
116                
117                int k = Matrix.idxMin(svals);
118                double smin = svals[k];
119                double smax = Matrix.max(svals); 
120                
121                RealVector qq = null;           // = \dot{q} solution vector (algebraic circle parameters)
122
123                double icond = smin / smax;
124                if (icond < 1e-12) {                    // smin/smax = inverse condition number of X, 1e-12
125                        // singular case (X is rank deficient)
126                        qq = V.getColumnVector(k);
127                } else {
128                        // regular (non-singular) case
129                
130                        // Version1 (seems to create smaller roundoff errors, better matrix symmetry):
131                        RealMatrix Y = V.multiply(S).multiply(V.transpose());
132                        RealMatrix Z = Y.multiply(Ci).multiply(Y); // = Y * Ci * Y
133                        
134                        // Version2:
135//                      RealMatrix Y = V.multiply(S);
136//                      RealMatrix Z = Y.transpose().multiply(Ci).multiply(Y); // = Y^T * Ci * Y
137                        
138                        EigenvalueDecomposition ed = new EigenvalueDecomposition(Z); 
139                        double[] evals = ed.getRealEigenvalues();
140                        int l = new SortMap(evals).getIndex(1); // index of the 2nd-smallest eigenvalue                 
141                        RealVector el = ed.getEigenvector(l);
142                        
143                        // Version1 ---------------------------------------------------
144//                      qq = Matrix.solve(S.multiply(svd.getVT()), el);         // solve S * V^T * p = el
145                        
146                        // Version2 ---------------------------------------------------
147                        qq = V.operate(MatrixUtils.inverse(S).operate(el));     // simpler since S is diagonal (i.e., easy to invert)
148                }
149
150                RealMatrix M = CircleFitAlgebraic.getDecenteringMatrix(xr, yr);
151                return M.operate(qq).toArray();  // q = (A,B,C,D)
152        }
153                
154}
